medium: Wool, nylon; supplementary warp and weft patterning
title: Window Box
text: Many of NUNO's designers have achieved the company's distinctive aesthetic through the use of treatments applied to the fabric after it is removed from the loom.  In this case the textile was subjected to diverse temperatures and abrasion in order to contract and felt the untwisted wool yarns. The resulting grid and the rippled effect of the nylon ground fabric reference the appearance of window frames.
description: purple float woven; cross laid strips of loosely spun wool in a nylon base were abraded to felt and exposed wool/ window frame areas which cause them to shrink and pucker; serged ends; selvedges self folded because of above procedure
creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons and Rosa Lynn Pinkus
